citations.narrative:
The facility purchased non-human primates of multiple species on 5/30/23 for resale purposes. Records reviewed for the
disposition of these non-human primates were not complete. No sales records were available for the following animals:
one ringtail lemur, 5 marmosets, 4 squirrel monkeys and one red handed tamarin. Complete disposition records are
required to allow for legal and medical tracing of the animals. The facility shall make, keep and maintain records or forms
which fully and correctly disclose all required disposition information for animals acquired including the name and address
of the person to whom an animal was given or sold, the date of disposal/sale, the species of animal and the number of
animals in the shipment.

The indoor housing room for the one spider monkey housed indoors currently has two electrical outlets on the walls. The
monkey may injure itself if playing with/coming in contact with the outlets. Housing facilities for nonhuman primates must
be constructed so that they protect the animals from injury.

The window surrounds and a section of wood molding in the indoor monkey room are in need of maintenance. These
wooden surfaces have lost their protective sealant surfaces and are no longer able to be readily cleaned and sanitized. All
surfaces that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized must be replaced or repaired to maintain the ability to be readily
cleaned and sanitized.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) and by July 8, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility purchased non-human primates of multiple species on 5/30/23 for resale purposes. Records reviewed for the 
disposition of these non-human primates were not complete. No sales records were available for the following animals: 
one ringtail lemur, 5 marmosets, 4 squirrel monkeys and one red handed tamarin. Complete disposition records are 
required to allow for legal and medical tracing of the animals. The facility shall make, keep and maintain records or forms 
which fully and correctly disclose all required disposition information for animals acquired including the name and address 
of the person to whom an animal was given or sold, the date of disposal/sale, the species of animal and the number of 
animals in the shipment. 
3.75(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The indoor housing room for the one spider monkey housed indoors currently has two electrical outlets on the walls. The 
monkey may injure itself if playing with/coming in contact with the outlets. Housing facilities for nonhuman primates must 
be constructed so that they protect the animals from injury. 
3.75(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The window surrounds and a section of wood molding in the indoor monkey room are in need of maintenance. These 
wooden surfaces have lost their protective sealant surfaces and are no longer able to be readily cleaned and sanitized. All 
surfaces that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized must be replaced or repaired to maintain the ability to be readily 
cleaned and sanitized. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) and by July 8, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee

and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
